Leaves: Oval to circular with a small point at the end. Up to 5 cm long. Without stalks.
Flowers: Oval-shaped white or pale-yellow up to 1.5 cm diameter. With barbed hairs at base. Become straw-coloured when mature.
FruitSeeds: Flower segments mature and detach from the stem to form prickly burrs containing one tiny yellowish amber or brown circular seed.
Habitat: Lawns, nature strips, footpaths, bare ground, pastures.
DistinguishingFeatures: Different leaves to Bindy eye (*Soliva sessilis*), and has prickles compared to Common joyweed (*Alternanthera nodiflora*) and Hairy joyweed (*A. nana*).
